column4: quick question, whats the current default desktop UI for ubuntu (11.04) called? and what was it's predecessor called?
ah unity, that's right
thanks :)
Are you having troubles seeing icons on the left side of your screen when you're in unity?
i removed unity. i think it's a serious p.o.s.
i'm using classic desktop, so GNOME :)
But did you?
uh, no, i saw the icons on the left. in the OSX kind of way
but creating new ones is just madness, imho
Alrighties. For some reason, mines is just missing icons
whoever thought of that should be ... well.
what do you mean with missing?
the bar is there though?
Yea. The name of the app appears only if I "over where the icons should be at".
sounds like a bug, but as you might be able to tell i'm not that much of an expert myself
It's like this picture here: http://i.imgur.com/Wa4Xx.jpg
ALrighties.
have you tried widening it?
I will just use Ubuntu classic.
i've actually fixed a silly bug with vertical rendering with the panels package manually :s
do you plan on having a vertical bar again?
